ball1.description: Felix discovers the joys of bouncing on a ball.
ball1.title: Ball 1

ball2.description: He's looking much older.  His face is thinner, his hair is bushier, and his actions are more controlled and nuanced.
ball2.title: Ball 2

ball3.description: After bouncing on the ball, he takes it for a ride.
ball3.title: Ball 3

brunch1.description: Brunch at our favorite local restaurant, Chow.
brunch1.title: Brunch 1

brunch2.description: Felix has a special waiter friend, Jason.  Jason takes him on tours of the kitchen.
brunch2.title: Brunch 2

brunch3.description: It was raining on a clear plastic roof.  Tres cool.
brunch3.title: Brunch 3

cozy1.description: Several times in the evenings, Felix has gathered blankets and pillows and built a little cozy fort on his cozy corner.  Mom or Dad usually helps with the architecture.
cozy1.title: Cozy 1

cozy3.description: Settling in for a nice read.  He's very into books now.  After his pre-bedtime bottle he brings a few books to the rocking chair for us to read.  He still doesn't want an actual story -- his tastes tend towards pop-up insects.
cozy3.title: Cozy 3

felix_site.description: Felix likes looking at the Felix site.  This picture always makes him rub his hands together (the baby sign for water).
felix_site.title: Felix Site

grandma.description: Grandma Harriet and Felix watch street life.
grandma.title: Grandma

read.description: The Teletubbies come in BOOK form, too!
read.title: Read

scrub.description: Felix loves to scrub, bless him.  Sponges, towels, potscrubbers, you name it.  He's got a stellar post-dinner career ahead of him at the Moses household.
scrub.title: Scrub

description:
Grandma Harriet was here for the weekend. She and the little man of the house hit it off, as always. The Moses family's social life pales in comparison to hers: baseball and basketball games, a book club, trips to New York, tennis, concerts, ad nauseum. And that's in just one week.

Felix seems much older and more intelligent, just in the last few days. He seems to understand a large part of what we say to him, though getting him to act on it is another matter (he still doesn't respond to "come here" at all). He's making up baby signs that we haven't figured out what they mean. For the first time tonight he did the hand gestures that go with the song "Wheels on the Bus".

Language is still funny and weird. Out of the blue, he'll repeat a word perfectly -- like "rain" -- but then never say it again. The baby sign for cat has disappeared, replaced by the sign for dog. Dog ate cat. All cats and other animals are dogs. He's starting to get intonations correct -- he makes sounds like he's counting 1-2-3, but he's not using any number system we've ever heard of.
title: April 13
